intro: Wormskioldia longepedunculata var. bussei, commonly known as the Cape fynbos. It is a flowering plant native to South Africa, characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. The plant belongs to the family Rutaceae and is typically found in coastal fynbos vegetation. It has a compact growth habit and is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value. The species is adapted to the Mediterranean climate of the region, with periods of drought tolerance.
